channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Live: U.S. Senate
channel.desc: Gavel-to-gavel and uninterrupted live coverage of the U.S. Senate from the Capitol Building in Washington, D.C.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Public Affairs Events
channel.desc: Public affairs events, congressional hearings, speeches, and interviews.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Public Affairs Events

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Public Affairs Events
channel.desc: Public affairs events, congressional hearings, speeches, and interviews.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: William & Mary Bray School Lab director Maureen Elgersman Lee discusses the history of the 18th-century Williamsburg Bray School for Black children and the legacies of the 300 to 400 scholars it enrolled.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: The Presidency
channel.desc: Theodore, Franklin, and Eleanor Roosevelt - and the matriarch of FDR's family, Sara Delano Roosevelt - all called New York home. Former Newsday reporter Bill Bleyer describes the city they knew & looks at how it shaped their personal lives and pol.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Washington Journal
channel.desc: A segment from a recent Washington Journal.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: Archaeologists announce the discovery of artifacts in western Pennsylvania now declared to be the site of a 1758 friendly fire incident; the incident involves a British regiment from Virginia led by George Washington during the French and Indian War.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Harlem Hellfighters Congressional Gold Medal Ceremony
channel.desc: Speaker Mike Johnson, Defense Secretary Hegseth and others host a gold medal ceremony honoring the Harlem Hellfighters, an African American infantry regiment in the New York National Guard known for their service in WWI and WWII.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: Twentieth century archival films on public affairs.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Q & A
channel.desc: David Kramer, Stephanie Streett, Alice Yates and Mark Updegrove talk about preserving the legacies of U.S. presidents.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This Office of War Information film documents the founding United Nations conference of April to June 1945 in which the U.N. Charter was created, debated, and signed by all 50 participating nations.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Eisenhower Address at the United Nations
channel.desc: President Eisenhower speaks at the United Nations about the destructive nature of the atomic bomb and urges the peaceful use of atomic energy.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: s Final Address to the U.N. General Assembly
channel.desc: President Kennedy, in what would be his last address before the United Nations General Assembly speak on limiting nuclear arms, nurturing worldwide human rights, and the space race evolving into joint exploration with the Soviet Union. This speech w.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Ronald Reagan United Nations General Assembly Address
channel.desc: President Ronald Reagan addresses the 39th Session of the United Nations General Assembly.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: George W. Bush UN General Assembly
channel.desc: In his first address to the United Nations General Assembly President Bush talks about joint counterterrorism efforts and the global threat of terrorism.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Netanyahu United Nations General Assembly
channel.desc: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu addresses the United Nations General Assembly.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Greta Thunberg Remarks at U.N. Climate Conference
channel.desc: Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg delivers remarks at the opening of the 2019 Climate Action Summit hosted by the United Nations in New York City.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Zelensky United Nations General Assembly
channel.desc: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi delivers remarks at the U.N. General Assembly in New York City.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Scott Anderson, King of Kings
channel.desc: New York Times Magazine's Scott Anderson discusses the 1979 Iranian Revolution that resulted in the overthrow of Mohammad Reza Pahlavi, the U.S.-backed Shah of Iran who ruled the country since 1941.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Misty Heggeness, Swiftynomics
channel.desc: Author Misty Heggeness talks about her concept of Swiftynomics, a case study of famous women who she claims have managed to thrive in a society largely built for men.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: FreedomFest 2025 - Adam Coleman, the Children We Left Behind

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Washington Journal
channel.desc: A forum for leading journalists and public policy makers to discuss key events and legislation.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Scott Anderson, King of Kings
channel.desc: New York Times Magazine's Scott Anderson discusses the 1979 Iranian Revolution that resulted in the overthrow of Mohammad Reza Pahlavi, the U.S.-backed Shah of Iran who ruled the country since 1941.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Misty Heggeness, Swiftynomics
channel.desc: Author Misty Heggeness talks about her concept of Swiftynomics, a case study of famous women who she claims have managed to thrive in a society largely built for men.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: FreedomFest 2025 - Adam Coleman, the Children We Left Behind

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Washington Journal
channel.desc: A forum for leading journalists and public policy makers to discuss key events and legislation.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Robert Macfarlane, Is a River Alive?
channel.desc: Robert Macfarlane argues for the importance of river ecosystems. Powell's Books in Portland, Oregon, hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Jason Taylor, The Brew Deal
channel.desc: The FDR Presidential Library & Museum hosts the 2025 Roosevelt Reading Festival, featuring authors on topics ranging from how beer helped end the Great Depression to the former Rough Rider in FDR's war cabinet.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Shoshana Walter, Rehab - An American Scandal
channel.desc: Investigative Reporter Shoshana Walter examines the for-profit drug rehabilitation treatment industry and argues that it fails to help people suffering from opioid addiction. Book Passage in Corte Madera, California, hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Q & A
channel.desc: Robert Malone talks about his book "PsyWar," in which he argues that the U.S. government uses psychological warfare against Americans to control them.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Tim Weiner, the Mission - The CIA in the 21st Century
channel.desc: Tim Weiner discusses the history and evolution of the Central Intelligence Agency from the end of the Cold War through the first quarter of the 21st century.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Yaakov Katz, While Israel Slept
channel.desc: Former Jerusalem Post editor-in-chief Yaakov Katz discusses why Hamas' surprise attack on Israel on Oct. 7, 2023, was successful.
